PagePlaceholderContentElements.Content:
How to edit this website?

If you want to edit this website, you need to log in to the Administrative console.

To open the console:

  1. Append "/Composite" to this website base URL and press Enter, or click here.
  2. Click "Start Composite" on the page that opens.
  3. In the login form, enter your username and password. Your username/password was specified by the admin setting up this site.

You will log in to the console defaulting to the Content perspective. Here, expand "Websites" and the front page below and select the page you want to edit.

You can find more user information on getting started with Composite C1 here.

Starter Site Features:

  • Desktop and mobile friendly. Based on cssgrid.net 12 column grid.
  • 5 basic templates: Frontpage, full width, 2 and 3 columns.
  • Top menu
  • Quick links like sitemap and other languages
  • Left menu, based on Composite.Navigation.Distributed package
  • Language switcher, based on Composite.Navigation.LanguageSwitcher package
  • Sitemap, based on Composite.Navigation.LevelSitemap package
  • Clean and lightweight markup and CSS - you can work with
  • Easy skinning
  • HTML meta tags done

Composite C1 Starter Site

Hi, and welcome to your Composite C1 starter site. This site is a set of minimalistic templates for starting a new site. You can use this site "as is" with light re-skinning, you can extend it with C1 Packages (blogs, extranet, event calendars etc.) and you can build a highly customized website on top of it.

If you are new to Composite C1:

Wish to edit this website? You can launch the C1 Console in your web browser and try to edit pages, upload images etc. with Composite C1. Read more in "How to edit this website" .

  • Start the C1 Console - this is where you work with your content etc. 
  • Getting started with Composite C1 - how to edit pages etc.
  • Videos for new users - how you log in, find and edit pages etc.
  • Installing packages - how you add features like blog, extranet, image galleries etc.

If you are a web developer:

  • Developer documentation - guides and videos for front-end and back-end developers
  • Documentation Search - this will search all the Composite C1 documentation
  • Forum - get help from the community!
